body.p: “Approaching carefully the little pool south of Hubbard’s Grove “,” I see th dimples where the croakers which were on the surface have dived “,” and I see two or three still spread out on the surface “,” in the sun. They are very wary “,” and instantly dive to the borrom on your approach and bury themselves in the weeds or mud.”
PE 13, pg. 333 / 25 November 1857-4 June 1858/ NNPM MA 1302:31 / T vol. # XXV / PDF # XVI / JX
